Claim: Schedules for the sale of milk, newspapers, grocery and medical stores have been issued by the Mumbai Police commissioner.
Explaination: It is a hoax. The Mumbai Police commissioner has not issued any such order.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Schedules for the sale of milk, newspapers, grocery and medical stores have been issued by the Mumbai Police commissioner.

Explanation:It is a hoax. The Mumbai Police commissioner has not issued any such order.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-police-did-not-fix-timings-for-grocery-and-medical-stores-in-mumbai-1659252-2020-03-24
ann12_remarks: I am 50-50 about Public preparedness and Public authority

Claim: Singapore government said confirmed case No. 12 is a prostitute. As a result, many of her clients are under quarantine.
Explaination: According to the Singapore health ministry, case no. 12 showed symptoms during the family trip in Singapore. The department hasn't released the occupation of case no. 12.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Singapore government said confirmed case No. 12 is a prostitute. As a result, many of her clients are under quarantine.

Explanation:According to the Singapore health ministry, case no. 12 showed symptoms during the family trip in Singapore. The department hasn't released the occupation of case no. 12.

https://tfc-taiwan.org.tw/articles/2684

Claim: Coronavirus Outbreak Prompted Gun And Ammunition Policy Changes At Walmart.
Explaination: Walmart had already changed its ammo sales policy on September 3, 2019, a month after a gunman killed 22 people at one of its stores in El Paso, Texas.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Coronavirus Outbreak Prompted Gun And Ammunition Policy Changes At Walmart.

Explanation:Walmart had already changed its ammo sales policy on September 3, 2019, a month after a gunman killed 22 people at one of its stores in El Paso, Texas.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471955-fact-check-coronavirus-did-not-prompt-gun-and-ammunition-policy-changes-at-walmart.html

Claim: COVID-19 is more deadly than Ebola or HIV.
Explaination: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be false. The post’s claim that coronavirus is the most deadly disease in history is not correct. Global fatalities for HIV and Ebola are far higher, figures from the World Health Organization and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention show.
Label: False
html:
Claim: COVID-19 is more deadly than Ebola or HIV.

Explanation:Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be false. The post’s claim that coronavirus is the most deadly disease in history is not correct. Global fatalities for HIV and Ebola are far higher, figures from the World Health Organization and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention show.

https://www.aap.com.au/the-2019-novel-coronavirus-not-more-deadly-than-ebola-or-hiv/

Claim: Evidence indicates COVID-19 escaped a Chinese lab that was researching it, causing the outbreak.
Explaination: Overall, Mosher’s argument is based on unfounded speculation and scientific inaccuracies. Multiple scientific studies have indicated that the virus has a natural origin, not the result of human engineering.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Evidence indicates COVID-19 escaped a Chinese lab that was researching it, causing the outbreak.

Explanation:Overall, Mosher’s argument is based on unfounded speculation and scientific inaccuracies. Multiple scientific studies have indicated that the virus has a natural origin, not the result of human engineering.

https://healthfeedback.org/evaluation/viral-new-york-post-article-perpetuates-the-unfounded-claim-that-the-covid-19-virus-is-manmade/

Claim: China has sought to kill 20,000 coronavirus patients to control the spread of the virus.
Explaination: No media outlet has reported it. Also, the claim originates from a rather suspicious website.
Label: False
html:
Claim: China has sought to kill 20,000 coronavirus patients to control the spread of the virus.

Explanation:No media outlet has reported it. Also, the claim originates from a rather suspicious website.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/china-permission-court-kill-thousands-coronavirus-petients-viral-1644347-2020-02-07

Claim: “The CDC can detain anyone with a fever indefinitely. Vaccination (is) a way people could get out of detention.”
Explaination: In the United States, people can't be quarantined for just having a fever; they have to be shown to have been exposed to one of a specific set of diseases. Most quarantines are done voluntarily, not by force of the government. And vaccination is not a ticket out of quarantine. Most quarantine decisions are up to states and localities, rather than the CDC.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “The CDC can detain anyone with a fever indefinitely. Vaccination (is) a way people could get out of detention.”

Explanation:In the United States, people can't be quarantined for just having a fever; they have to be shown to have been exposed to one of a specific set of diseases. Most quarantines are done voluntarily, not by force of the government. And vaccination is not a ticket out of quarantine. Most quarantine decisions are up to states and localities, rather than the CDC.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/16/blog-posting/clarifying-whats-accurate-and-not-claims-about-qua/

Claim: Chinese state media claims Ghana’s coronavirus cases have surpassed 9,000, with over 400 deaths.
Explaination: Official Ghana government data contradicts the claims. And a Senior Correspondent at Xinhua News Agency, Accra Bureau has conceded the claims are wrong.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Chinese state media claims Ghana’s coronavirus cases have surpassed 9,000, with over 400 deaths.

Explanation:Official Ghana government data contradicts the claims. And a Senior Correspondent at Xinhua News Agency, Accra Bureau has conceded the claims are wrong.

https://ghanafact.com/false-chinese-state-media-claims-ghanas-coronavirus-cases-have-surpassed-9000-with-over-400-deaths/

Claim: Roche has developed a COVID-19 vaccine.
Explaination: A video claiming that the pharmaceutical company has developed a vaccine for COVID-19 contains false information.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Roche has developed a COVID-19 vaccine.

Explanation:A video claiming that the pharmaceutical company has developed a vaccine for COVID-19 contains false information.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-video-claiming-that-roche-has-developed-a-vaccine-against-covid-19-is-a-hoax-7eddf408dc46?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: An audio clip claims Kenya has recorded 63 cases of COVID-19.
Explaination: An audio clip claiming that Kenya has recorded 63 cases of novel coronavirus has been edited and taken out of context. The clip was part of a training exercise by the Ministry of Health to prepare for a likely outbreak ahead of the opening of a quarantine center in Nairobi.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An audio clip claims Kenya has recorded 63 cases of COVID-19.

Explanation:An audio clip claiming that Kenya has recorded 63 cases of novel coronavirus has been edited and taken out of context. The clip was part of a training exercise by the Ministry of Health to prepare for a likely outbreak ahead of the opening of a quarantine center in Nairobi.

https://pesacheck.org/false-kenya-has-not-recorded-63-covid-19-cases-475c6a941155

Claim: The Australian prime minister is about to announce a national lockdown.
Explaination: The claim is misleading; the Australian Prime Minister’s Office refuted the details of the post; Australia's government told its citizens on March 18 not to travel abroad and warned those already overseas to come home but did not order a "lockdown"; AFP found the wording of the misleading posts was identical to Malaysia’s announcement of a nationwide lockdown.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: The Australian prime minister is about to announce a national lockdown.

Explanation:The claim is misleading; the Australian Prime Minister’s Office refuted the details of the post; Australia's government told its citizens on March 18 not to travel abroad and warned those already overseas to come home but did not order a "lockdown"; AFP found the wording of the misleading posts was identical to Malaysia’s announcement of a nationwide lockdown.

https://factcheck.afp.com/misinformation-circulates-online-australia-has-announced-nationwide-lockdown

Claim: A Chinese woman in Mombasa was attacked and killed after showing flu-like symptoms and refusing to go to hospital.
Explaination: The article uses an image from the 2013 Westgate terror attack in Kenya, and police in the area also had not received any information about the attack.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Chinese woman in Mombasa was attacked and killed after showing flu-like symptoms and refusing to go to hospital.

Explanation:The article uses an image from the 2013 Westgate terror attack in Kenya, and police in the area also had not received any information about the attack.

https://pesacheck.org/hoax-reports-that-a-chinese-woman-was-killed-in-mombasa-over-covid-19-fears-are-false-c7d6913ce5ae?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: The coronavirus pandemic can be dramatically slowed, or stopped, with the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.
Explaination: Maintaining an adequate intake of vitamin C is important for staying healthy. However, evidence from clinical trials shows that regular vitamin C supplementation does not prevent viral respiratory tract infections such as the common cold, which can be caused by coronaviruses, in the general population. Although some studies have shown a reduced incidence of the common cold in individuals undergoing severe physical stress, such as marathon runners.
Label: No evidence
html:
Claim: The coronavirus pandemic can be dramatically slowed, or stopped, with the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.

Explanation:Maintaining an adequate intake of vitamin C is important for staying healthy. However, evidence from clinical trials shows that regular vitamin C supplementation does not prevent viral respiratory tract infections such as the common cold, which can be caused by coronaviruses, in the general population. Although some studies have shown a reduced incidence of the common cold in individuals undergoing severe physical stress, such as marathon runners.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/vitamin-c-supplementation-does-not-prevent-viral-respiratory-infections-such-as-those-caused-by-coronaviruses-in-the-general-population/

Claim: Videos of a patient gasping for breath is shown as a patient from India.
Explaination: The video is not from India but Ecuador where the person was suffering from acute respiratory distress syndrome.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Videos of a patient gasping for breath is shown as a patient from India.

Explanation:The video is not from India but Ecuador where the person was suffering from acute respiratory distress syndrome.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/covid-19-video-of-patient-gasping-for-breath-falsely-linked-to-india-7439

Claim: Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets.
Explaination: The video is not related to coronavirus but with London riots that happened in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between 6 and 11 August 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets.

Explanation:The video is not related to coronavirus but with London riots that happened in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between 6 and 11 August 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15320709?check=3
ann12_remarks: This combines several claims and each can be attributed to a different category

Claim: Tanzanian club spokesman Haji S. Manara was infected with COVID-19 during his tour of The Netherlands.
Explaination: Tanzania's Simba Sports Club spokesman Haji S. Manara does not have COVID-19 as claimed, and he was tested after leaving Spain and when he entered the Netherlands.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Tanzanian club spokesman Haji S. Manara was infected with COVID-19 during his tour of The Netherlands.

Explanation:Tanzania's Simba Sports Club spokesman Haji S. Manara does not have COVID-19 as claimed, and he was tested after leaving Spain and when he entered the Netherlands.

https://pesacheck.org/false-simba-sports-club-spokesman-haji-s-manara-has-not-been-infected-with-covid-19-5909c15e6e6b

Claim: Bus driver in China vomits blood after becoming unconscious behind the wheel.
Explaination: This video dates back to 2015 when a driver in Xiamen, China was suffering from gastrointestinal bleeding.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Bus driver in China vomits blood after becoming unconscious behind the wheel.

Explanation:This video dates back to 2015 when a driver in Xiamen, China was suffering from gastrointestinal bleeding.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/02/17/fact-check-video-from-wuhan-where-a-man-suffering-from-corona-virus-is-seen-vomiting-blood/

Claim: Post says “President Trump has come into contact with a potential coronavirus sufferer!”
Explaination: There is no evidence President Donald Trump came into direct contact with a coronavirus sufferer.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Post says “President Trump has come into contact with a potential coronavirus sufferer!”

Explanation:There is no evidence President Donald Trump came into direct contact with a coronavirus sufferer.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/10/facebook-posts/headline-ignores-evidence-overstating-trumps-expos/

Claim: “Putin has stated: Russian citizens (have) 2 options: Stay home for 15 days or in jail for 5 years.”
Explaination: Russian President Vladimir Putin has implemented some policies to cancel large gatherings and keep people at home during the coronavirus pandemic. But we could not find any evidence that he has threatened jail time for people who don't comply.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “Putin has stated: Russian citizens (have) 2 options: Stay home for 15 days or in jail for 5 years.”

Explanation:Russian President Vladimir Putin has implemented some policies to cancel large gatherings and keep people at home during the coronavirus pandemic. But we could not find any evidence that he has threatened jail time for people who don't comply.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/24/instagram-posts/putin-didnt-threaten-jail-time-coronavirus-lockdow/

Claim: Satellite images show high levels of sulphur dioxide above China are possible evidence of mass cremations of people who have died from coronavirus.
Explaination: False. The maps are not satellite images, and do not show actual levels of sulphur dioxide. They are simply forecasts based on historical data and weather patterns.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Satellite images show high levels of sulphur dioxide above China are possible evidence of mass cremations of people who have died from coronavirus.

Explanation:False. The maps are not satellite images, and do not show actual levels of sulphur dioxide. They are simply forecasts based on historical data and weather patterns.

https://fullfact.org/health/satellites-wuhan-sulphur-dioxide-coronavirus/

Claim: Celebrities spreading misinformation about coronavirus and the Janata curfew in India.
Explaination: The celebrities shared posts that were already debunked about the 12 hour curfew on March 22 in India.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Celebrities spreading misinformation about coronavirus and the Janata curfew in India.

Explanation:The celebrities shared posts that were already debunked about the 12 hour curfew on March 22 in India.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/how-celebs-amplified-misinformation-around-janta-curfew-7317

Claim: Woman burned her hands while putting on the stove due to high alcohol content in hand sanitizer.
Explaination: It is a hoax. Alcohol in hand sanitisers evaporate completely once applied on the hands.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Woman burned her hands while putting on the stove due to high alcohol content in hand sanitizer.

Explanation:It is a hoax. Alcohol in hand sanitisers evaporate completely once applied on the hands.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-viral-sanitiser-burn-1659085-2020-03-24

Claim: Red soap and white handkerchiefs are good against the coronavirus.
Explaination: But the recommended practices are misleading; health experts told AFP there is no scientific basis for many of the claims, which include using red-coloured soap and white handkerchiefs, as well as obtaining specific light bulbs.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Red soap and white handkerchiefs are good against the coronavirus.

Explanation:But the recommended practices are misleading; health experts told AFP there is no scientific basis for many of the claims, which include using red-coloured soap and white handkerchiefs, as well as obtaining specific light bulbs.

https://factcheck.afp.com/red-soap-white-handkerchiefs-experts-refute-misleading-coronavirus-prevention-tips

Claim: Weed (cannabis) cures coronavirus.
Explaination: In the absence of any evidence, the claim is found to be misleading.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Weed (cannabis) cures coronavirus.

Explanation:In the absence of any evidence, the claim is found to be misleading.

https://fit.thequint.com/fit-webqoof/fit-webqoof-could-weed-kill-the-novel-coronavirus

Claim: You can monitor yourself for COVID-19 with a breath test.
Explaination: Holding your breath for 10 seconds isn’t a way to test that you don't have COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: You can monitor yourself for COVID-19 with a breath test.

Explanation:Holding your breath for 10 seconds isn’t a way to test that you don't have COVID-19.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/13/viral-image/dont-hold-your-breath-isnt-credible-way-test-coron/

Claim: Video shows Chinese police crackdown on coronavirus patients.
Explaination: The video actually dates back to August 2019 when anti-government protests were happening in Hong Kong. The visuals pertain to an incident of police crackdown at Prince Edward station in Kowloon where the police personnel and riot police arrived after reports of a tussle between pro-government and anti-government protesters.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video shows Chinese police crackdown on coronavirus patients.

Explanation:The video actually dates back to August 2019 when anti-government protests were happening in Hong Kong. The visuals pertain to an incident of police crackdown at Prince Edward station in Kowloon where the police personnel and riot police arrived after reports of a tussle between pro-government and anti-government protesters.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/video-from-hong-kong-painted-as-police-action-on-covid-19-suspects

Claim: “There’s magically already a vaccine available.”
Explaination: Anthony S. Fauci, a top official at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), told Bloomberg Law that a potential vaccine "could move into early-stage human testing in the next three months."
Label: False
html:
Claim: “There’s magically already a vaccine available.”

Explanation:Anthony S. Fauci, a top official at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), told Bloomberg Law that a potential vaccine "could move into early-stage human testing in the next three months."

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471529-fake-news-patent-for-coronavirus-that-expired-is-not-for-new-strain-killing-people-in-china.html?check=2

Claim: A post says that a vaccine for the new coronavirus will be available in a few days.
Explaination: The image that is shown on the post is a South Korean COVID-19 test from the laboratory Sugentech. There is not a vaccine available on the market yet.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A post says that a vaccine for the new coronavirus will be available in a few days.

Explanation:The image that is shown on the post is a South Korean COVID-19 test from the laboratory Sugentech. There is not a vaccine available on the market yet.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-vacina-que-cura-doentes-covid-19-em-tres-horas-vai-ser-lancada-no-domingo/

Claim: Novel coronavirus has a 99.7% survival rate.
Explaination: The CDC did not confirm this, and the user did not offer any citations for clarification of this fact.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Novel coronavirus has a 99.7% survival rate.

Explanation:The CDC did not confirm this, and the user did not offer any citations for clarification of this fact.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471832-fact-check-it-is-not-known-whether-novel-coronavirus-has-a-survival-rate-of-997-percent.html

Claim: A post says that WHO has adviced against unprotected sex with animals to prevent a coronavirus infection.
Explaination: The image attributed to the World Health Organization was digitally manipulated. The recommendation was never to avoid unprotected contact with wild and farm animals.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: A post says that WHO has adviced against unprotected sex with animals to prevent a coronavirus infection.

Explanation:The image attributed to the World Health Organization was digitally manipulated. The recommendation was never to avoid unprotected contact with wild and farm animals.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-oms-desaconselha-sexo-desprotegido-com-animais-para-prevenir-coronavirus/

Claim: Three thousand Ecuadorians are infected with coronavirus.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Three thousand Ecuadorians are infected with coronavirus.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/

Claim: Students in America have to repeat the same grade next year.
Explaination: Stories about students having to repeat their grade originated on hoax sites.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Students in America have to repeat the same grade next year.

Explanation:Stories about students having to repeat their grade originated on hoax sites.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/31/facebook-posts/dont-fall-these-hoaxes-about-students-having-repea/

Claim: “People are going door to door in Colorado Springs stating they are COVID-19 testing so they can rob people!”

Claim: “People are going door to door in Colorado Springs stating they are COVID-19 testing so they can rob people!”

Explanation:Colorado Springs police said they’ve received no reports of robbers pretending to offer coronavirus testing.

Claim: A dog vaccine can be used against coronavirus in people.
Explaination: There is still no approved vaccine for coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A dog vaccine can be used against coronavirus in people.

Explanation:There is still no approved vaccine for coronavirus.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471975-Fact-Check-Dog-Vaccine-Can-NOT-Be-Used-To-Inoculate-People-Against-Coronavirus.html

Claim: Tokyo Olympics logo has been redesigned on the theme of social distancing.
Explaination: The Tokyo Olympics logo has not been redesigned.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Tokyo Olympics logo has been redesigned on the theme of social distancing.

Explanation:The Tokyo Olympics logo has not been redesigned.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/no-olympics-did-not-redesign-its-logo-on-social-distancing-theme-1659321-2020-03-24

Claim: Dettol sanitizer kills coronavirus and the company knew about the existence of the virus before the outbreak in China.
Explaination: Dettol kills older strains of coronavirus but has not tested the new strain yet. coronavirus is a family of strains infecting mammals and humans.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Dettol sanitizer kills coronavirus and the company knew about the existence of the virus before the outbreak in China.

Explanation:Dettol kills older strains of coronavirus but has not tested the new strain yet. coronavirus is a family of strains infecting mammals and humans.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/did-dettol-know-about-coronavirus-outbreak-beforehand-a-factcheck-6767

Claim: In a video, the Chinese prime minister offers namaz (prayer) during the coronavirus scare.
Explaination: The video was uploaded in 2015 by Associated Press and it shows the former Malaysian Prime Minister visiting Beijing’s Nan Xia Po Mosque. He took part in the Friday prayers during his five-day trip to China.
Label: False
html:
Claim: In a video, the Chinese prime minister offers namaz (prayer) during the coronavirus scare.

Explanation:The video was uploaded in 2015 by Associated Press and it shows the former Malaysian Prime Minister visiting Beijing’s Nan Xia Po Mosque. He took part in the Friday prayers during his five-day trip to China.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/china-pm-offering-namaz-to-cure-coronavirus-fact-check

Claim: Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus.
Explaination: The predictions of Nostradamus are not correctly translated, and even if Nostradamus truly predicted a “plague”, the title of the original article says that it is taking place in a seaside town. The coronavirus originated in the city of Wuhan in China, which is not a seaside town, which can be confirmed by a simple Google search.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus.

Explanation:The predictions of Nostradamus are not correctly translated, and even if Nostradamus truly predicted a “plague”, the title of the original article says that it is taking place in a seaside town. The coronavirus originated in the city of Wuhan in China, which is not a seaside town, which can be confirmed by a simple Google search.

https://truthmeter.mk/sensationalist-and-irresponsible-article-claiming-nostradamus-predicted-the-coronavirus/

Claim: President Donald Trump announced a vaccine by Roche Diagnostics.
Explaination: Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for testing kits, not a vaccine.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Donald Trump announced a vaccine by Roche Diagnostics.

Explanation:Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for testing kits, not a vaccine.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/no-trump-did-not-announce-the-launch-of-a-coronavirus-vaccine-by-roche-7248

Claim: Ibuprofen ramps up coronavirus 10 times.
Explaination: There is no evidence that ibuprofen or other similar drugs exacerbate the disease. Instead, the notion is simply a hypothesis that has not been tested.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Ibuprofen ramps up coronavirus 10 times.

Explanation:There is no evidence that ibuprofen or other similar drugs exacerbate the disease. Instead, the notion is simply a hypothesis that has not been tested.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/no-evidence-to-back-covid-19-ibuprofen-concerns/

Claim: The Chinese Communist Party “will finally admit that the real source of the coronavirus is from ‘a lab in Wuhan’ linked to its covert biological weapon programs.”
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:
Claim: The Chinese Communist Party “will finally admit that the real source of the coronavirus is from ‘a lab in Wuhan’ linked to its covert biological weapon programs.”

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

https://www.politifact.com/facebook-fact-checks/statements/2020/jan/28/blog-posting/no-evidence-chinese-officials-will-say-coronavirus/

Claim: Green chiratta can prevent COVID-19.
Explaination: No scientific evidence for that.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Green chiratta can prevent COVID-19.

Explanation:No scientific evidence for that.

https://factcheck.afp.com/thai-health-experts-say-there-no-evidence-green-chiretta-herb-can-prevent-novel-coronavirus

Claim: 20 million Chinese convert to Islam, and coronavirus does not affect Muslims.
Explaination: The video doesn't feature Chinese people, but rather Filipino men. Video footage predates major coronavirus reports.
Label: False
html:
Claim: 20 million Chinese convert to Islam, and coronavirus does not affect Muslims.

Explanation:The video doesn't feature Chinese people, but rather Filipino men. Video footage predates major coronavirus reports.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471717-fake-news-twenty-million-chinese-did-not-covert-to-islam-after-it-was-proven-that-coronavirus-epidemic-did-not-afflict-muslims.html

Claim: A WhatsApp forward claimed that a vaccine for coronavirus has been discovered and that the treatment for coronavirus is mentioned in an Intermediate Zoology book.
Explaination: The viral forward reads, “It is not a new disease as it is already mentioned in the Intermediate zoology book along with its treatment. It happens sometimes that many great scientists and doctors do not focus on lesser-known books as they are mostly busy with famous books. Book name: Zoology, Writer: Dr. Ramesh Gupta, Page No. 1072.) Friends, this is not fake news so I request you to kindly share it maximum so all coronavirus patients are treated in time.”The treatments mentioned in the viral page of the book are first of all not a treatment for coronavirus but a treatment for common cold caused by a coronavirus which is negated partially by various research reports so the viral claim that there is pre-existing medication for coronavirus, is ‘Misleading’.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A WhatsApp forward claimed that a vaccine for coronavirus has been discovered and that the treatment for coronavirus is mentioned in an Intermediate Zoology book.

Explanation:The viral forward reads, “It is not a new disease as it is already mentioned in the Intermediate zoology book along with its treatment. It happens sometimes that many great scientists and doctors do not focus on lesser-known books as they are mostly busy with famous books. Book name: Zoology, Writer: Dr. Ramesh Gupta, Page No. 1072.) Friends, this is not fake news so I request you to kindly share it maximum so all coronavirus patients are treated in time.”The treatments mentioned in the viral page of the book are first of all not a treatment for coronavirus but a treatment for common cold caused by a coronavirus which is negated partially by various research reports so the viral claim that there is pre-existing medication for coronavirus, is ‘Misleading’.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15330807?check=1

Claim: People in Italy are throwing money on the road because they are saddened by the fact that all the money in the world could not save their dear ones.
Explaination: Our investigation revealed that the photos are from Venezuela. Last year, bank robbers had thrown the old banknotes on the road to make the point that the currency of the country was worthless. It has nothing to do with coronavirus
Label: False
html:
Claim: People in Italy are throwing money on the road because they are saddened by the fact that all the money in the world could not save their dear ones.

Explanation:Our investigation revealed that the photos are from Venezuela. Last year, bank robbers had thrown the old banknotes on the road to make the point that the currency of the country was worthless. It has nothing to do with coronavirus

https://marathi.factcrescendo.com/old-photos-from-venezuela-shared-as-bank-notes-thrown-on-the-streets-of-italy/

Claim: Chinese people flee to Vietnam due to COVID-19.
Explaination: The video is from november 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese people flee to Vietnam due to COVID-19.

Explanation:The video is from november 2019.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-circulated-online-weeks-novel-coronavirus-was-first-reported

Claim: The health service in Ireland is asking people to stockpile food.
Explaination: The claim was untrue. The health service is not urging people to stockpile food - in fact, the opposite is true - and the supply chains in Ireland remain robust
Label: False
html:
Claim: The health service in Ireland is asking people to stockpile food.

Explanation:The claim was untrue. The health service is not urging people to stockpile food - in fact, the opposite is true - and the supply chains in Ireland remain robust

https://jrnl.ie/5045982

Claim: An image of coffins showing the victims of COVID-19 in Italy.
Explaination: A Facebook post with an image claiming to show the victims of COVID-19 in Italy uses a photo of the coffins of African immigrants who drowned off the coast near Lampedusa in 2013.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image of coffins showing the victims of COVID-19 in Italy.

Explanation:A Facebook post with an image claiming to show the victims of COVID-19 in Italy uses a photo of the coffins of African immigrants who drowned off the coast near Lampedusa in 2013.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-image-of-coffins-in-italy-was-taken-in-2013-not-2020-190ad6db1d81?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: Dallas student celebrating spring break collapses from coronavirus.
Explaination: Came from fake news generator website.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Dallas student celebrating spring break collapses from coronavirus.

Explanation:Came from fake news generator website.

https://leadstories.com//3471927-Fact-Check-NO-Dallas-Student-Celebrating-Spring-Break-On-South-Padre-Island-Did-NOT-Suddenly-Collapse-From-Coronavirus.html

Claim: Says that “over a 45-minute period that we had the press conference” on the coronavirus on March 13, 2020, the stock market set “an all-time record.”
Explaination: The Dow had a record-high point increase on the day Trump declared a national emergency in response to coronavirus, with the surge accelerating during his late-afternoon news conference. But that followed a record point decrease the previous day. And it was followed by a sharp drop by the opening of the next trading day, which saw continued declines before closing.
Label: HALF TRUE
html:
Claim: Says that “over a 45-minute period that we had the press conference” on the coronavirus on March 13, 2020, the stock market set “an all-time record.”

Explanation:The Dow had a record-high point increase on the day Trump declared a national emergency in response to coronavirus, with the surge accelerating during his late-afternoon news conference. But that followed a record point decrease the previous day. And it was followed by a sharp drop by the opening of the next trading day, which saw continued declines before closing.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/19/donald-trump/stock-market-record-point-rise-followed-record-poi/
